Original title: The Thieves (Dodookdeul)
Country: South Korea
USA release: 12/10/2012

Studio: CJ Venture Investment, KM Culture Co., Michigan Venture Capital
Directed by Choi Dong-Hoon
Screenplay: Choi Dong-Hoon, Lee Gi-Cheol
Starring: Kim Yun-Seok, Kim Hye Soo, Lee Jung-Jae, Jun Ji-hyun, Kim Hae-Suk, Kim Soo-Hyun, Simon Yam, Oh Dal-Su, Angelica Lee, Kwok Cheung Tsang, Shin Ha- Kyun Joo Jin-Mo, Guk-Ki Seo, Deok-Mun Choi, Gook-Hee Chae, Soo-Jung Ye

Synopsis:
An international group of thieves led by Macau-Park (Kim Yun-seok) is preparing to implement a master plan to strike at a casino century. But there is no honor among thieves, each separately organized his own personal plan to be the one to stay with the loot.

Production notes:
Directed by Choi Dong-hun ("Woochi, Demon Hunter") and starring Kim Yun-seok ("The Yellow Sea", "Woochi, Demon Hunter"), Gianna Jun ("Blood: The Last Vampire") and Simon Yam ("Election", "Ip Man"), "The Thieves" has managed to make history by becoming the highest grossing film of all time in South Korea, snatching the far held since "The Host" of Bong Joon-ho. Almost $ 90 million of revenue and nearly 14 million viewers certify the extraordinary ability of its director, Choi Dong-hun, for super-high-caliber productions, as it did with "Woochi, Demon Hunter" and the excellent form of Korean cinema: "THE BIG HIT" is a box office hit does not seek localism, but worldwide success. Public success which also adds to its presence at film festivals internationally renowned Busan, Hawaii, Toronto, and its presentation in Spain that was in the Official Selection of the Festival of Sitges 2012.
